intro: Hieracium subphalarograptum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands, and it has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green ray florets, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium subphalarograptum is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of nutrient-rich environments.
